title: Listen to Oil Prices and You Can Hear Echoes of the 1970s

On Monday, the global crude oil benchmark briefly spiked to $139 a barrel, doubling from a year ago, as an embargo on Russian oil exports was discussed. title: 2021-2022 Federal Income Tax Brackets and Rates
summary: Proposals in Congress to raise top income-tax rates have failed to gain traction. The tax code currently has seven income-tax brackets for individuals that range from 10% to 37%. The 10% rate takes effect at the first dollar of taxable income, after benefits such as the standard deduction are applied. Each tax rate applies to income in that bracket. So a taxpayer whose last dollars are taxed at 24% will likely have portions of income taxed at 0, 10%, 12% and 22%.
Prediction:
- The 10% bracket will increase to 12%.
- The 12% bracket will increase to 22%.
- The 22% bracket will increase to 37%.
- The other brackets will remain the same.
